com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class GetTrustScoreRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.GetTrustScoreRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordKeyProvider, Serializable

    public class GetTrustScoreRequest
extends SiperianRequest
implements RecordKeyProvider
    Retrieves the current trust score for the specified column in a base object record. The column must be trust-enabled in the Schema Manager of the Hub console. The trust score (type float) of the Admin system will be returned, system name passed as a part of RecordKey is being ignored!. Use setTrustSetting(TrustSetting) to override the Admin system trust setting with a custom trust setting. When overriding trust, all properties of the trust setting must be specified. For more details, see TrustSetting.

    Required Parameters:

    • setColumnUid(String) - Specifies the column object UID for which to retrieve the trust score. Trust must be enabled on this column.
    • setRecordKey(RecordKey) - Specifies the record for which to retrieve the trust score.
    Usage Example:

    The following example retrieves the trust score for column FIRST_NAME on base object C_CONTACT for the record with rowid = 3:

    GetTrustScoreRequest request = new GetTrustScoreRequest();
    request.setColumnUid("COLUMN.C_CONTACT|FIRST_NAME"); // Required
    request.setRecordKey(RecordKey.rowid("3")); // Required
    GetTrustScoreResponse response = (GetTrustScoreResponse)
    sipClient.process(request);
    See Also:
    GetTrustScoreResponse, TrustSetting, SiperianClient.process(SiperianRequest), Serialized Form

    API Pair: GetTrustScoreResponse

    API Group: Data Steward

        setColumnUid(String)

      • setColumnUid

        public void setColumnUid(String columnUid)
        Sets the column UID for which to obtain the trust score. Trust must be enabled for this column.

        An example column UID is "COLUMN.CONTACT_PKG|FIRST_NAME", where "CONTACT_PKG" is the physical name of the package and "FIRST_NAME" is the physical name of the column. A column UID can refer to a base object instead; for example, "COLUMN.C_CONTACT|FIRST_NAME" where "C_CONTACT" is the physical name of the base object and "FIRST_NAME" is the physical name of the column.

        Parameters:
        columnUid - Column UID
